business.headline: Luxury vs affordable housing: What homebuyers prefer during festive seasonThe festive months are traditionally seen as an auspicious time to buy homes. But as real estate sentiment rises across cities, one question stands out — are buyers chasing luxury spaces or choosing affordability amid rising costs?

LIC refutes Washington Post report on $3.9-billion Adani investment planA Washington Post report claimed that the Finance Ministry expedited a proposal directing nearly $3.9 billion (Rs 33,000 crore) in investments from the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) into the Adani Group. The life insurance major rejected the claims as baseless.
Writing a will? These common mistakes can land it in courtFrom Bollywood families to neighbourhood households, inheritance battles have shown that even the most watertight wills can spring leaks.

Reliance says it will comply with new US, Western sanctions on Russian oilThe oil-to-retail behemoth said that it is assessing the implications of restrictions announced by the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States on crude oil imports from Russia and the export of refined products to Europe.

No trade deals with a gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talksThis special report covers Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's firm message on India's approach to international trade negotiations, particularly regarding the United States. Speaking at the Berlin Global Dialogue, Mr. Goyal made it clear that India will not be rushed into agreements. He stated, 'we do not do deals in a hurry, and we do not go ahead and sign any deals with deadlines or with a gun to our head'. The minister emphasized that for India, trade deals are not merely about tariffs or market access but are long-term partnerships built on trust and mutual respect between nations. This stance comes amid ongoing trade discussions with both the US and the European Union, where India is advocating for fair and equitable agreements that benefit its businesses and economy in the long run.

Don't do deals with gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USIndia is exploring newer markets to reduce the impact of high tariffs and ensure fair trade terms for its exporters, said Piyush Goyal. He noted that India's approach is guided by strategy and self-interest rather than external pressure.
Sensex closes 320 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; HUL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 344.52 points to close at 84,211.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.25 points to end at 25,795.15.

Have you been investing in mutual funds the wrong way all this time?Experts say that most investors rely only on absolute returns while judging a mutual fund's performance. They focus on the number showing how much profit they've made, without understanding the factors behind those returns.

US maize import talks rattle Indian farmers as prices fall below MSPReports suggest that if the trade deal goes through and American maize starts entering Indian markets — prices could crash, and farmers may face huge losses.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: Why the stock market is falling todayThe fall came as investors engaged in profit booking following recent gains. After sustained upward movements, it is common for markets to experience short-term corrections as participants secure returns.

Gold ETFs vs physical gold: What smart investors are looking at, explains expertGold may be timeless, but the way Indians invest in it is changing fast. With rising awareness of hidden costs, gold ETFs are gaining traction as a smarter, hassle-free alternative.

How Piyush Pandey made India fall in love with adsPiyush Pandey transformed Indian advertising with heartfelt stories and local flavour. His campaigns blended wit and emotion, leaving a lasting cultural impact.

Remembering Piyush Pandey: The ad legend who made brands immortalFor over four decades, the Jaipur-born storyteller reshaped Indian advertising, turning simple commercials into cultural phenomena and making brands like Fevicol, Cadbury, and Asian Paints inseparable from the Indian consciousness.​

CA explains why saving before spending works best for financial stabilityWhile most people save whatever is left after spending, CA Meenal Goel flips the approach. Her mantra, prioritise savings before expenses, has helped her stay financially secure and stress-free.

Error in your ITR filing? Here's how to correct it with an updated returnRealised there's an error in your ITR after submission? You're not alone. Many taxpayers make small mistakes while filing, but the good news is — you can still correct them through an updated return.

Why the world's central banks are buying gold like never beforeNot just households and investors, but central banks around the globe are buying gold like it's Dhanteras every day. So why are the world's biggest buyers going for bullion? Read on to find out.
Target announces 1,800 job cuts in a decade amid falling salesAll corporate employees in the US have been asked to work from home next week as the company finalises its restructuring process.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: Is the rally over and what should you do next?After a nine-week winning streak, gold and silver prices are finally losing steam as investors book profits amid a stronger dollar, easing global tensions, and anticipation over key US economic data.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as FMCG stocks offset metal gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 96.63 points to 84,459.77, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 24.20 points to 25,866.45 as of 9:28 am.

Midwest listing today: Will it give investors profit? See what GMP suggestsMidwest IPO was subscribed 92.36 times overall. The retail portion was booked 25.52 times, the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category saw 146.99 times, while the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category was subscribed 176.57 times.

entertainment.headline: We don't stage grief: Ishitta Arun defends laughter at Piyush Pandey's funeral Ishitta Arun addressed criticism for laughing at uncle Piyush Pandey's funeral, saying it was her way of celebrating his lively spirit and that grief can be expressed in different ways.

BB 19 Episode 64: Baseer Ali and Nehal Chudasama exit show in double eviction 'Bigg Boss 19' shocked fans with a double eviction as Baseer Ali and Nehal Chudasama were eliminated in a dramatic Weekend Ka Vaar episode, shaking up alliances and adding fresh twists to the race for the trophy.

He was with us: Deven Bhojani opens up on Sarabhai team's farewell to Satish Shah The farewell to veteran actor Satish Shah was both emotional and unique, as the 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai' team sang the show's title track around his pyre. Director Deven Bhojani shared that it felt like a final tribute from Indravadan Sarabhai himself, a perfect goodbye to the beloved actor.

Kriti Sanon enjoys fight night with rumoured boyfriend Kabir Bahia, Varun Dhawan Kriti Sanon enjoyed UFC 321 in Abu Dhabi with rumoured boyfriend Kabir Bahia and Varun Dhawan, fuelling fresh dating buzz. Her post with Kabir has reignited chatter about their relationship.

Raveena Tandon comes onboard Suriya-Venky Atluri film, team wishes her on birthday Raveena Tandon joins Tamil superstar Suriya's 'Suriya 46', with the team marking her birthday. The film, produced by Sithara Entertainments, has begun shooting and is already generating excitement among fans.

Sidharth Shukla's fans will save me: Shehbaz Badesha. He's delusional, say fans 'Bigg Boss 19' wildcard Shehbaz Badesha sparked controversy by claiming backing from late Sidharth Shukla's fans, drawing criticism for allegedly exploiting the actor's legacy.

Rasha Thadani shares throwback pics, calls Raveena Tandon trendsetter on birthday Rasha Thadani wished mother Raveena Tandon a happy birthday on social media with heartfelt messages and throwback photos, calling her the "original trendsetter."

Satish Shah funeral: Inconsolable Rupali Ganguly, Rajesh Kumar in tears Veteran actor Satish Shah, famed for 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', received an emotional farewell in Mumbai, with co-stars Rupali Ganguly and Rajesh Kumar visibly moved. He died at 74 on Saturday, October 25.

After Latent row, Samay Raina apologises to people with disabilities on birthday On his birthday today, comedian Samay Raina issued an apology for his jokes about people with disabilities following the 'India's Got Latent' controversy. His statement came in the wake of Supreme Court scrutiny over his remarks.

House of Dynamite review: Kathryn Bigelow crafts a smart but inconsistent thrillerRelease Date:Fri Oct 24, 2025 Kathryn Bigelow's 'A House of Dynamite' is a gripping Netflix political thriller exploring the fallout of a mysterious warhead launch through a Rashomon-style lens. With strong turns by Idris Elba and Rebecca Ferguson, it's a tense study of power and fear, though its pacing and emotional depth occasionally falter.

Amitabh Bachchan and Salman Khan mourn Satish Shah's death: Life lived kingsize Veteran actor and comedian Satish Shah, celebrated for 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai' and several Bollywood hits, died in Mumbai at 74 due to kidney failure. Tributes poured in from across the industry, with Amitabh Bachchan and Salman Khan remembering his humour, warmth, and timeless charm.

Stalin calls Bison Kaalamaadan another gem in Mari Selvaraj's crown Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin praised Mari Selvaraj's 'Bison Kaalamaadan'. The politician called it another gem in the director's crown.

Harshvardhan Rane urges fans to support outsiders with his film and Thamma Harshvardhan Rane encourages moviegoers to watch both 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' and 'Thamma', celebrates outsider achievements, and addresses audience influence on nepotism as both films perform well at the box office.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Vijay Sethupathi roasts Parvathy, Kamrudin, calls house toxic In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss Tamil 9', Vijay Sethupathi didn't mince words as he called out contestants for their toxic conduct and lack of discipline inside the house.

Katy Perry, Justin Trudeau walk hand-in-hand in Paris amid dating rumours. Watch Amid dating rumours, a video of singer Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau walking hand-in-hand in Paris after celebrating Perry's birthday, has emerged online.
Naya Daur: The trial beyond the tracks A love story lost to circumstance, a film that redefined progress — 'Naya Daur' became both a cinematic triumph and a tragic elegy.

Nikitin Dheer shares emotional note after immersing father Pankaj Dheer's ashes Actor Nikitin Dheer posted a heartfelt message after losing his father, Pankaj Dheer, on October 15. He even immersed the late actor's ashes at Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Rishikesh.

BB19 Episode 63: Salman Khan's ex-wives remark stirs tension for Abhishek Bajaj Salman Khan's indirect comment referencing ex-wives caused tension for Abhishek Bajaj during 'Bigg Boss 19's Weekend Ka Vaar. The host highlighted the intense public scrutiny facing contestants and questioned the dynamics in the house.

Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat box office Day 5: Harshvardhan's film hit by Thamma wave 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' earned Rs 34 crore in five days despite limited screens. The film outperformed expectations and remained steady alongside bigger releases like 'Thamma'.

general news.headline: US deepening ties with Pak won't come at cost of India relations: Marco RubioUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio emphasises the US commitment to strengthening ties with both India and Pakistan without compromising historic relations. He highlights the strategic balance Washington seeks amid evolving regional dynamics.

Poll body to announce pan-India SIR dates, 10-15 states likely in 1st phaseThe poll body is expected to unveil the first phase of the SIR, covering 10 to 15 states, including those scheduled for Assembly elections in 2026. Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Kerala, Assam, and Puducherry are among the states set to go to the polls next year.

Law student's head slashed, stomach ripped open, fingers cut over payment disputeIn Kanpur, 22-year-old LLB student Abhijeet Singh Chandel was brutally attacked with a cleaver by a medical store owner and his associates over a payment dispute. The assault left his head slashed, stomach ripped open, intestines exposed, and fingers severed.

Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards 2025: Power, creativity and purposeThe Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards returned to Mumbai for its second India edition, celebrating women of influence across film, fashion, art, and business. From Zeenat Aman and Janhvi Kapoor to Falguni Nayar and Anamika Khanna, the evening honoured icons and innovators shaping India's cultural landscape.

Pratika Rawal's injury mars India's washed-out group finale against BangladeshIndia's group stage campaign came to an end with an abandoned fixture against Bangladesh in Navi Mumbai. A game which saw 36.4 overs in total was dominated by India before incessant rain denied them a win, which was just 69 runs away.

Lesson for them: Madhya Pradesh minister's shocker on cricketers' molestationKailash Vijayvargiya faces intense backlash for his remarks on the molestation of Australian women cricketers in Indore, suggesting that players should exercise caution while travelling and notify local authorities or security personnel in advance.

India, China direct flights resume after 5-year freeze amid thaw in tiesDirect flights between India and China have resumed after over five years, marking a significant step in restoring connectivity. This move is expected to boost trade, tourism, and diplomatic relations between the two nations.

I'm stitched in love, friendship: Kalli Purie at Harper's Bazaar women awardsKalli Purie, Vice Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief of the India Today Group, spoke about unexpected challenges she faced before appearing at the Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year 2025. Her remarks focused on the strength found in solidarity and support within the fashion community.

Techies by day, cabbies at night: Why Bengaluru engineers are driving Ola, UberEver had cab drivers in Bengaluru answer your call in fluent corporate lingo? Chances are, they might have been techies. It's not just for the money. Software engineers are driving cabs to beat loneliness at home and drudgery at the office, revealing a problem in our corporate culture.

US says 100% tariff threat to China averted ahead of Trump-Xi meet in South KoreaUS and China reached a tentative trade deal framework ahead of the Trump–Xi meeting, pausing tariffs, delaying China's rare earths export curbs, and aiming to stabilize trade and soybean purchases.

Acid attack on Delhi University student near college; stalker, 2 others on the runPolice said her stalker, Jitender, and two associates threw acid on her as she walked to class. The victim suffered burns on both hands and is being treated at a local hospital.

Cyclone Montha to hit Andhra on Oct 28, Odisha cancels officials' leavesCyclone Montha is expected to make landfall on the Andhra Pradesh coast near Kakinada, between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam, on Tuesday evening or night (October 28).

One last time: Rohit Sharma signs off from Australia, heads back to IndiaIndia's star batter Rohit Sharma signed off for one last time from Australia after his heroics during the recently-concluded ODI series. Rohit was adjudged as the Player Of The Series for his heroics with the bat.

Aravind Srinivas says internet is too important to leave in hands of GooglePerplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas takes a dig at Google's monopoly, saying the internet is too important to leave in the hands of Google. But, he also knows that his AI-powered web browser, Comet, cannot beat Google Chrome just yet.

Doctor suicide case: Family says palm note not full story, seeks special probeA young woman doctor from Maharashtra was found dead under suspicious circumstances, sparking demands for an independent investigation amid allegations of workplace pressure and foul play. The family insists there is more to the case than the brief suicide note found on her palm, urging a thorough probe with external oversight.

Being called Bihari was a disgrace once, now a matter of pride: Nitish KumarNitish Kumar, in a post on X, said law and order has improved in Bihar since 2005, and being called a Bihari, once seen as a disgrace, is now a matter of pride.

Rahane's message to Sarfaraz Khan amid selection row: Keep your head down and focusAjinkya Rahane scored a commanding 159 in the Ranji Trophy and shared advice for Sarfaraz Khan. His message stresses patience and focus amid ongoing national team selection challenges.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

16 Haryana men deported from US, police probe donkey route trailSixteen men from Karnal district deported from the United States have been reunited with their families, as police investigate the illegal networks they allegedly used to reach the US after paying large sums of money.

With strong turns by Idris Elba and Rebecca Ferguson, it's a tense study of power and fear, though its pacing and emotional depth occasionally falter.

Soha Ali Khan on raising Inaaya, paparazzi culture, and social media boundariesSoha Ali Khan opens up about raising daughter Inaaya, handling fame, and setting social media boundaries on 'Anything But'.

Drunk drivers are terrorists: Hyderabad top cop after Andhra bus tragedyDays after 20 people died in a bus fire in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool, Hyderabad Police Commissioner VS Sajjanar gave a stern message for drunk drivers, saying they were "terrorists". He said no leniency would be given to them for such "acts of terror".

Israel will decide which foreign forces enter Gaza: Netanyahu on ceasefireThe Israeli Prime Minister confirmed Israel's authority to approve foreign troops in the planned international Gaza force under the US peace plan. The US supports Israel's position, but troop contributions from Arab states remain uncertain amid the ongoing Gaza conflict.

Biker killed in Andhra bus fire was drunk, case against him for reckless drivingPolice have booked deceased biker Shivashankar for negligent and reckless driving that led to the Kurnool bus fire killing 20 people. The FIR states he was drunk and lost control before the fatal crash.

sports.headline: Jannik Sinner wins Vienna Open title after fighting back to beat Alexander Zverev Vienna Open: Jannik Sinner beat Germany's Alexander Zverev 3-6, 6-3, 7-5 in the final on Sunday, securing his fourth ATP Tour title of the season. Sinner has now won 21 consecutive matches on indoor hardcourts.

Why the Chess World Cup 2025 could shape the future of Indian chess The Chess World Cup 2025 is a crucial tournament for India's players. With the home advantage, they must make the most of this opportunity to ensure the continued strength and depth of Indian chess in the coming years.

Premier League: Arsenal extend lead at the top, Manchester City suffer loss Arsenal secured a narrow victory over Crystal Palace, thanks to Eberechi Eze's first league goal for the club on Sunday, October 26. Manchester City's winning run came to an end against Aston Villa as Matty Cash's goal proved to be decisive.

El Clasico: Real Madrid down Barcelona 2-1 to extend lead at top of LaLiga Kylian Mbappe and Jude Bellingham were on target as Real Madrid beat Barcelona 2-1 to strengthen their spot at the top of the LaLiga points table. Barca were left to rue their chances and lost Pedri to a red card in the final moments of the game.

Pratika Rawal freak injury: Harmanpreet Kaur shares an update on India opener Women's World Cup, IND vs BAN: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur shared an update on Pratika Rawal, who sustained an injury during the clash against Bangladesh at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Chess World Cup 2025: Decoding the format of the tournament The Chess World Cup 2025 will be played from October 31, 2025 to November 27, 2025 and this represents a golden chance for the Indian Chess grandmasters to seal their spot in the Candidates 2026 tournament.

A game which saw 36.4 overs in total was dominated by India before incessant rain denied them a win, which was just 69 runs away.

Amy Jones lauds England spin-depth as focus shifts to semi-final showdown Amy Jones praised England's spinners for a brilliant collective performance that helped restrict New Zealand, highlighting the team's depth and adaptability. With the semi-final against South Africa in Guwahati next, she emphasised focus and confidence heading into the clash.

Sophie Devine on ODI retirement after NZ vs ENG: Proud of making this decision Sophie Devine said that she is proud to call time on her career after retiring from ODIs after New Zealand's final game of the Women's World Cup 2025 against England. Devine played 159 ODIs for the White Ferns.

Pratika Rawal suffers freak injury in big blow for India before semis Women's World Cup 2025: India has suffered a big injury scare ahead of the semifinal clash against Australia, with their star opener, Pratika Rawak, suffering an injury during the final league match against Bangladesh.

After India Test team snub, Nair makes statement with 25th first-class hundred Karun Nair sent a message to the selectors by scoring his 25th first-class century during the Ranji trophy clash against Goa on Sunday, October 26. Nair remained unbeaten on 174 as Karnataka put up 371 runs in the first innings.

Rahane's message to Sarfaraz Khan amid selection row: Keep your head down and focusAjinkya Rahane scored a commanding 159 in the Ranji Trophy and shared advice for Sarfaraz Khan. His message stresses patience and focus amid ongoing national team selection challenges.

Why Sophie Devine denied teammates from giving guard honour before England tieNew Zealand captain Sophie Devine explained why she refused her teammates from giving a guard of honour before the England tie on Sunday, October 26. Devine called time on her ODI career with the game in Vizag.

Sophie Ecclestone injured before semis? Nat Sciver-Brunt updates on England spinnerWomen's World Cup, ENG vs NZ: Left-arm spinner Sophie Ecclestone bowled only four balls in her spell in New Zealand's innings in Visakhapatnam before she went off the park due to a shoulder injury.

Riyan Parag leads Assam to script unwanted record in Ranji Trophy historyRiyan Parag starred with the ball as Assam fell to a heavy defeat against Services, scripting an unwanted Ranji Trophy record despite his valiant efforts.

Celebrate Virat Kohli, let him find balance in life at end of career: AB de VilliersAB de Villiers has urged the fans to celebrate Virat Kohli and support him, irrespective of what decision he makes in terms of his career. Kohli came back into form during the third ODI against Australia.

Harmanpreet Kaur is my idol, 171 against Australia inspired me: Sobhana MostaryWomen's World Cup 2025: In an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, Bangladesh batter Sobhana Mostary said that she idolises Harmanpreet Kaur and started following her since the 171-run knock against Australia in the semi-finals of the 2017 edition in Derby.

Arne Slot gives bizarre reason for Liverpool's pricey yet poor formLiverpool's Premier League title defence has hit a worrying slump after four straight defeats. Arne Slot blamed the team's away-heavy schedule and rival tactics for their poor form, calling it a key reason behind the slide.

Australian Cricketers Molested On Indore Street | Molester ArrestedThis special report covers the shocking incident in Indore where two Australian women cricketers, in India for the ICC Women's World Cup, were stalked and molested. According to the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Secretary Devajit Saikia, 'It is a very unfortunate incident that brings disrepute'. The incident occurred when the players were walking from their hotel to a cafe, prompting immediate police action. An FIR was lodged and the accused, identified as Akil Khan, was arrested based on a bystander's tip. The report delves into the political fallout and the serious questions raised about the safety of international athletes and women in India, an act that has brought global shame during a major tournament.

England and New Zealand give Sophie Devine guard of honour in emotional ODI farewellWomen's World Cup 2025: Sophie Devine received a guard of honour from both teams in her final ODI, capped by a special jersey from England, closing a stellar career that included 4,000+ runs and a T20 World Cup triumph as New Zealand captain.

One last time: Rohit Sharma signs off from Australia, heads back to IndiaIndia's star batter Rohit Sharma signed off for one last time from Australia after his heroics during the recently-concluded ODI series. Rohit was adjudged as the Player Of The Series for his heroics with the bat.

Devine's farewell ODI ends in heartbreak as New Zealand lose tamely to EnglandWomen's World Cup, ENG vs NZ: Sophie Devine scored 23 runs and a wicket in her farewell ODI, but New Zealand finished their campaign with an eight-wicket defeat to Nat Sciver-Brunt's England in Visakhapatnam.

Chess World Cup 2025: How many Indians are playing in the tournament?D Gukesh headlines the list of stars battling it out for the Chess World Cup title as the tournament returns to India after a gap of 23 years. Arjun Erigaisi, Praggnanandhaa, Vidit Gujrathi are among the other big names in the tournament.

Who is Uma Chetry? All you need to know about India's ODI debutant from AssamUma Chetry made her ODI debut for India against Bangladesh in the Women's World Cup. Meanwhile, India have won the toss and chose to bowl first.

Are ODIs boring? Ex-cricketer calls for more multi-laterals after IND vs AUSFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra believes that bilateral ODIs have lost their charm and hold no meaning at all. Chopra wants the boards to come together and play multi-lateral series more.

Belinda Bencic puts behind 10-year-old heartbreak to claim titleSwiss star Belinda Bencic capped her comeback with a fairytale triumph at the 2025 Pan Pacific Open, defeating Czech rising star Linda Noskova 6–2, 6–3 in Tokyo to claim her 10th WTA title.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
